item.title: Making Meaningful Models
item.description:
Motivation

In epidemiological modeling, we often rely on spatial covariates like poverty or unemployment. But even with rich data, unmeasured spatial factors continue to influence disease risk. Traditional models like the Besag-York-MolliÃ© (BYM) framework attempt to capture these unknowns with structured random effects, but they donâ€™t always tell us why certain patterns emerge.

This post explores how Topological Data Analysis (TDA) can help us understand latent spatial structures and augment Bayesian disease models with geometric insight.
